description.narrative: By end of 2016, monitoring and delivery of basic social services for children is strengthened through the integration of efficient and inclusive innovative technologies and approaches, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 6 / Cross-sectoral programme: National monitoring and evaluation structures provide reliable data for monitoring SDGs and other national goals and advocacy for children and women by the end of 2016

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas
Sanitation and Hygiene - climate resilience and environmental sustainability

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF Burundi continues to use innovation in the form of new technologies, products, partnerships, and processes as an integral part of its programme implementation to deliver improved outcomes, with a focus on real-time data collection, youth and community engagement, and climate change. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
